sd_properties.label: Understanding Society - Module HOUSEHOLD_W1

dcomments.dcomment: Most timestamps were returned in a separate TIMINGS file, but have been inserted into the specification at the point at which they were desiged to be recorded. The assumption in all cases is that the timestamp value was assigned on the basis of the system clock.

qt_properties.label: Time at start of household questionnaire

specification_elements.information: This interview is completely voluntary, if we should come to any question that you don't want to answer, just let me know and we'll go onto the next question.

sd_properties.label: Household interview

qt_properties.iipretext: RECORD WHO IS ANSWERING HOUSEHOLD QUESTIONNAIRE RECORD PERSON NUMBERS FROM HOUSEHOLD GRID
qt_properties.label: PNO of person answering HH questions

dcomments.dcomment: Most timestamps were returned in a separate TIMINGS file, but have been inserted into the specification at the point at which they were desiged to be recorded. The assumption in all cases is that the timestamp value was assigned on the basis of the system clock.

qt_properties.label: Time at end of household interview (Household Grid)

qt_properties.help: Exclude any rooms currently or usually sublet to persons outside the household but include any rooms solely occupied by lodgers within households. You should already know if lodgers are present, if necessary check 'Does this include the rooms occupied by....?'. Exclude conservatories.
qt_properties.iiposttext: IF BEDSIT, CODE 0 AT HSBEDS AND 1 AT HSROOMS F9 FOR HELP
qt_properties.label: Number of bedrooms
qt_properties.source: BHPS (revised to ask about number of bedrooms)
qt_properties.text: I would like to ask you a few questions about your household's accommodation. How many bedrooms are there here excluding any bedrooms you may let or sublet?

qt_properties.help: Exclude any rooms currently or usually sublet to persons outside the household but include any rooms solely occupied by lodgers within households. You should already know if lodgers are present, if necessary check 'Does this include the rooms occupied by....?'. Exclude conservatories.
qt_properties.iiposttext: 'OTHER ROOMS' ARE LIVING ROOMS, DINING ROOMS, STUDIES AND PLAYROOMS, BUT NOT CONSERVATORIES UNLESS USED AS A LIVING ROOM ALL YEAR ROUND F9 FOR HELP
qt_properties.label: Number of other rooms
qt_properties.text: And how many other rooms do you have in your accommodation, excluding kitchens and bathrooms?

qt_properties.help: Shared ownership includes co-ownership and equity sharing schemes: a share in the property is being bought. The occupier may never become the sole owner of the property but will receive a cash sum on leaving the scheme. Where accommodation is owned or part-owned by ex-spouse or separated spouse treat as 'owned' (code 1). Do not count as rent-free cases where a rent would normally be paid but the whole amount is rebated (or paid direct to the landlord by the DWP through Housing Benefit). Code people who live in rent free accommodation owned by relatives as 'rent free'. If rent is paid for them by a relative or charity this should be recorded as a regular receipt in the finance grids.
qt_properties.iiposttext: F9 FOR HELP
qt_properties.label: House owned or rented
qt_properties.text: Does your household own this accommodation outright, is it being bought with a mortgage, is it rented or does it come rent-free?

sd_properties.label: accommodation owned outright, being bought on mortgage or part-owned part-rented

qt_properties.help: If part owned with someone outside houshold enter 0 for this person. If household rents, give person actually responsible to landlord for rent. With adult sharers establish if there is a joint tenancy or if it is in one or two person's names, with others paying their share of the cost to them. If rent-free, give number of person responsible for the rent-free occupancy by virtue of job or family position.
qt_properties.iiposttext: IF OWNER IS NOT IN THE HOUSEHOLD ENTER 0 CODE ALL THAT APPLY F9 FOR HELP
qt_properties.label: PNO of person(s) owning accommodation
qt_properties.text: In whose name is this (house/flat/room) owned?

qt_properties.iiposttext: IF RANGE GIVEN WRITE IN LOWEST FIGURE WRITE IN AMOUNT IN £
qt_properties.label: Value of property: home owners
qt_properties.text: About how much would you expect to get for your home if you sold it today?

ck_properties.label: Value of property is less than 50,000 or greater than 500,000

qt_properties.help: Accept estimate if exact year not known. If accommodation was previously rented by household members who then purchased as sitting tenants record year bought outright or first started paying mortgage.
qt_properties.iiposttext: F9 FOR HELP
qt_properties.label: Year became owner: home owners
qt_properties.text: In what year did you buy or first become the owner of this property?

qt_properties.help: We need here the total purchase price of the property including any payment for the land, fixtures and fittings, garages etc. If respondent purchased with others, record total cost rather than respondent's share.
qt_properties.iiposttext: IF PAID NOTHING/INHERITED CODE 0 WRITE IN AMOUNT IN £ F9 FOR HELP
qt_properties.label: Original purchase price of property
qt_properties.text: How much did you pay for the property?

ck_properties.label: Purchase price of property is less than 50,000 or greater than 500,000

sd_properties.label: accommodation being bought on mortgage or part-owned part-rented

qt_properties.label: Year mortgage began
qt_properties.text: In what year did you first start paying a mortgage on this house/flat?

qt_properties.help: The total amount secured is the current outstanding balance plus any subsequent loans still outstanding
qt_properties.iiposttext: WRITE IN AMOUNT IN £ F9 FOR HELP
qt_properties.label: Total amount secured against property
qt_properties.text: Could I just check, approximately how much is the total amount secured against this property, including your mortgage and any other loans secured on the property?

qt_properties.label: Years left on mortgage
qt_properties.text: How many years has the mortgage still to run?

qt_properties.help: An endowment mortgage has a long term insurance policy attached which pays off the original loan. Do not count as endowment policies mortgages with a 'mortgage protection policy' which is life insurance only. A repayment mortgage is a straightforward loan where the borrower(s) repay capital and interest together.
qt_properties.iiposttext: READ OUT F9 FOR HELP
qt_properties.label: Type of mortgage

option.text: Part interest only and part repayment
option.label: Pt interest/pt repayment

option.text: Or some other type of mortgage or loan?
option.label: Other mortgage/loan

qt_properties.text: Is your mortgage or loan ...

qt_properties.iiposttext: INCLUDE LIFE INSURANCE PAYMENTS IF PAID WITH MORTGAGE. IF ENDOWMENT MORTGAGE, INCLUDE BOTH PREMIUMS AND INTEREST. IF DON'T KNOW, PROBE FOR APPROXIMATE AMOUNT. WRITE IN AMOUNT IN £
qt_properties.label: Last total monthly mortgage payment
qt_properties.text: How much was your last total monthly instalment on the mortgage(s) or loan(s)?

sd_properties.label: accommodation is rented or rent-free

qt_properties.label: Accommodation with present job: renter
qt_properties.text: Does the accommodation go with the present job of anyone in the household?

qt_properties.help: If the household rents, give person actually responsible to landlord for rent. With adult sharers establish if there is a joint tenancy in the names of all members of the household, or if it is just one or two person's names, with the others paying their share of the rent to the legal tenants. If rent-free, give number of individuals responsible for the rent-free occupancy by virtue of job or family position.
qt_properties.iiposttext: IF TENANT IS NOT IN HOUSEHOLD ENTER 0 F9 FOR HELP
qt_properties.label: Who rents accommodation
qt_properties.text: In whose name is this (house/flat/room) rented?

ck_properties.label: Accommodation is rented in more than four names

qt_properties.help: Any household whose accommodation is tied to the job of one of its members this should be coded 06 or 09 as appropriate. People in tied accommodation whose employer is a Local Authority or New Town should also be coded 06.

icomments.icomment: Please can we have the heading 'INDIVIDUALS' in between response options 7 and 8

qt_properties.iiposttext: F9 FOR HELP
qt_properties.label: Landlord of rented accommodation

option.text: Scottish Homes/Communities Scotland Scottish Special Housing Association
option.label: Scot Homes/Communities

option.text: Other Housing association, cooperative or charitable trust
option.label: Other HA/coop/charitble

qt_properties.text: Who is the accommodation rented from or provided by?

qt_properties.help: In any doubtful case ask 'What is the agreement with your landlord?' and code accordingly.
qt_properties.iiposttext: READ OUT F9 FOR HELP
qt_properties.label: Accommodation rented furnished or other
qt_properties.text: Do you rent your accommodation...

sd_properties.label: accommodation is rented

qt_properties.help: If normal amount paid includes payment for hot water or heating, try to get the amount paid for rent only. Where it is not possible to get a separate rent amount, record whole amount paid and code extra items included at RentInc.
qt_properties.iiposttext: IF 100% RENT REBATE CODE 0 IF DON'T KNOW, PROBE FOR APPROXIMATE AMOUNT WRITE IN AMOUNT IN £ F9 FOR HELP
qt_properties.label: Net amount of last rent payment
qt_properties.text: How much was the last rent payment, including any services or water charges but after any rebates?

sd_properties.label: last rental payment is provided

qt_properties.label: Weeks covered by last rental payment
qt_properties.text: What period did this cover?

qt_properties.iiposttext: CODE ALL THAT APPLY
qt_properties.label: Payments included

option.text: Heating or lighting or hot water
option.label: Heating or lighting or hot water

qt_properties.text: Did your last rent include any payment for any of the following things?

qt_properties.help: Both rent rebate and rent allowance are forms of housing benefit. If the recepient is in council accommodation they will receive a rent rebate i.e. pay a reduced rent. But if the respondent is renting privately then a rent allowance will be paid either directly to the recepient or to the recepient's landlord.
qt_properties.iiposttext: F9 FOR HELP
qt_properties.label: Housing Benefit
qt_properties.text: Was any Housing Benefit such as rent rebate or rent allowance deducted from the last rent payment?

sd_properties.label: receives rent rebate or rent allowance

qt_properties.iiposttext: IF DON'T KNOW, PROBE FOR APPROXIMATE AMOUNT WRITE IN AMOUNT IN £
qt_properties.label: Gross rent including Housing Benefit
qt_properties.text: So what would the last rent payment have been if Housing Benefit had not been deducted from it?

qt_properties.iiposttext: READ OUT
qt_properties.label: Domestic fuel
qt_properties.text: Which of the following types of domestic fuel do you have in your accommodation...

sd_properties.label: has gas and electricity in accommodation

qt_properties.label: Separate or combined gas and electricity bill
qt_properties.text: Do you pay your gas and electric as one bill or separately?

sd_properties.label: pay gas and electric as one bill

qt_properties.label: Amount electricity and gas
qt_properties.text: In the last year, since INTERVIEW MONTH INTERVIEW YEAR - 1, how much has your household spent on gas and electricity combined?

sd_properties.label: has electricity and does not pay gas and electricity as one bill

qt_properties.iiposttext: ENTER '0' IF NOTHING SPENT
qt_properties.label: Amount electricity
qt_properties.text: In the last year, since INTERVIEW MONTH INTERVIEW YEAR - 1, how much has your household spent on electricity?

sd_properties.label: has gas and does not pay gas and electricity as one bill

qt_properties.iiposttext: ENTER '0' IF NOTHING SPENT
qt_properties.label: Amount gas
qt_properties.text: In the last year, since INTERVIEW MONTH INTERVIEW YEAR - 1, how much has your household spent on gas including calor gas?

sd_properties.label: has oil in accommodation

qt_properties.iiposttext: ENTER '0' IF NOTHING SPENT
qt_properties.label: Amount oil
qt_properties.text: In the last year, since INTERVIEW MONTH INTERVIEW YEAR - 1, how much has your household spent on oil?

sd_properties.label: has other fuel type in accommodation

qt_properties.iiposttext: ENTER '0' IF NOTHING SPENT
qt_properties.label: Amount other fuel
qt_properties.text: In the last year, since INTERVIEW MONTH INTERVIEW YEAR - 1, how much has your household spent on other fuel, including solid fuel?

qt_properties.help: Central heating includes any system where two or more rooms are heated from a central source. If a household has only one room, treat as centrally heated from central source along with other rooms in the house/block.
qt_properties.iiposttext: F9 FOR HELP
qt_properties.label: Central heating
qt_properties.text: Do you have any form of central heating, including any electric storage heaters, in your (part of the) accommodation?

qt_properties.label: Install solar panels for electricity

option.text: Considered in the past and rejected
option.label: Considered and rejected

qt_properties.text: Have you installed or are you seriously considering any of the following... solar panels for electricity?

qt_properties.label: Install solar water heating

option.text: Considered in the past and rejected
option.label: Considered and rejected

qt_properties.text: Solar water heating?

qt_properties.label: Install wind turbine to generate electricity

option.text: Considered in the past and rejected
option.label: Considered and rejected

qt_properties.text: A wind turbine to generate electricity?

sd_properties.label: has electricity in accommodation

qt_properties.label: Considering Green Tariff

option.text: Considered in the past and rejected
option.label: Considered and rejected

qt_properties.text: Does your household buy, or is your household seriously considering buying its electricity on a Green Tariff? By Green Tariff we mean a payment scheme where your electricity supplier provides electricity from renewable sources such as wind power to the National Grid for the amount you use.

qt_properties.label: Separate items for recycling

option.text: SPONTANEOUS: No recycling through normal rubbish collection
option.label: Not thru norm collection

qt_properties.text: Do you separate your rubbish into items that can be recycled through your normal rubbish collection always, usually, sometimes or never?

qt_properties.label: Frequency of using bottle bank

option.text: SPONTANEOUS No recycling facility in area
option.label: No recycling in area

qt_properties.text: And how often does your household use bottle banks in your area?

qt_properties.label: Frequency of using paper recycling point

option.text: SPONTANEOUS No recycling facility in area
option.label: No recycling in area

qt_properties.text: Paper or cardboard recycling points?

qt_properties.label: Frequency of using Plastic bag recycling point

option.text: SPONTANEOUS No recycling facility in area
option.label: No recycling in area

qt_properties.text: Plastic bag recycling point, including at a supermarket?

qt_properties.label: Frequency of using garden waste recycling facility

option.text: SPONTANEOUS No recycling facility in area
option.label: No recycling in area

qt_properties.text: Garden waste recycling facilities?

sd_properties.label: address in England, Wales or Scotland

qt_properties.help: This question refers to the Council Tax valuation bands, not the market value of the respondent's house. Please ask them to check their Council Tax bill if possible. Many renters may not know the band if it is included in their rent. Code these as 'Don't know'. If the household accommodation is not valued separately e.g. a granny flat or a bedsit, code 09.

icomments.icomment: Please note that the figures in column 1 refer to England, column 2 to Scotland and column 3 to Wales

qt_properties.iiposttext: THIS MUST BE THE BAND SET BY THE COUNCIL. DO NOT ACCEPT INFORMANT'S OWN ESTIMATE OF VALUE OF PROPERTY. F9 FOR HELP
qt_properties.label: Council tax band

option.text: A up to £40000 up to £27000 up to £30000
option.label: A

option.text: Household accommodation not valued separately/included in rent
option.label: Household accommodation not valued separately/included in rent

qt_properties.text: Could you please tell me which Council Tax band this accommodation is in? The bands run from Band A to Band H.

sd_properties.label: house being bought on a mortgage, part-rented or rented

qt_properties.help: Applies to any accommodation lived in by householder or spouse during the past 12 months, not just current accommodation. If a mortgage has only recently been taken out refer to previous housing situation.
qt_properties.iiposttext: F9 FOR HELP
qt_properties.label: Behind with rent/mortgage
qt_properties.text: Many people find it hard to keep up with their housing payments. In the last twelve months, have you ever found yourself behind with your rent/mortgage?

sd_properties.label: council tax band provided

qt_properties.label: Behind with Council Tax
qt_properties.text: In the last twelve months, have you ever found yourself behind with paying your Council Tax?

qt_properties.label: Up to date with all bills

option.text: Up to date with all bills
option.label: Up to date w all bills

qt_properties.text: Sometimes people are not able to pay every household bill when it falls due. May I ask, are you up to date with all your household bills such as electricity, gas, water, rates, telephone and other bills or are you behind with any of them?

qt_properties.help: Include both owned and rented items. Include items made available by the landlord for personal use by household members. Include second hand purchases. Include home computers even if only used for games, but only if it has a keyboard. Include computers used for business purposes by self-employed people, but not those provided by employers for work at home. Exclude any items which are broken and will not be repaired. Include hire-purchase and credit sales but not rentals with a future option to purchase. Exclude gifts or loans to household members from persons outside the household, but include gifts between household members.
qt_properties.iiposttext: IF COMBINED TV/VIDEO CODE 1 & 2 IF COMBINED WASHER/DRIER CODE 6 & 7 F9 FOR HELP
qt_properties.label: Consumer durables in accommodation

option.text: Deep freeze or fridge freezer (EXCLUDE: fridge only)
option.label: Deep freeze or fridge freezer (EXCLUDE: fridge only)

option.text: Compact disc player (INCLUDE if part of a sound system)
option.label: Compact disc player (INCLUDE if part of a sound system)

qt_properties.text: Could you please tell me which of the following items you have in your (part of the) accommodation. Just tell me the numbers that apply.

sd_properties.label: there is a home computer in the household

qt_properties.label: Access to the internet
qt_properties.text: Does your household have access to the internet from home?

sd_properties.label: household has access to the internet from home

qt_properties.help: A broadband connection usually allows users to speak on a landline telephone at the same time as being connected to the internet.
qt_properties.iiposttext: F9 FOR HELP
qt_properties.label: Broadband connection
qt_properties.text: Do you have a broadband connection from your home computer?

qt_properties.label: Food consumption intro
qt_properties.text: The next questions are about how much your household has spent in the last four weeks on food eaten at home and food bought outside the home. Please include expenditure for all household members even if you are not sure of the exact amounts other people spend.

qt_properties.iiposttext: DO NOT INCLUDE MEALS OR SNACKS PURCHASED AND EATEN OUTSIDE THE HOME IF DON'T KNOW, ASK FOR ESTIMATE ENTER '0' IF NOTHING SPENT WRITE IN AMOUNT IN £
qt_properties.label: Amount spent on food from food shops
qt_properties.text: About how much has your household spent in total on food and groceries in the last four weeks from a supermarket or other food shop or market? Please do not include alcohol but do include non-food items such as paper products, home cleaning supplies and pet foods.

qt_properties.iiposttext: INCLUDE TAKEAWAYS DELIVERED TO THE HOME IF DON'T KNOW, ASK FOR ESTIMATE ENTER '0' IF NOTHING SPENT WRITE IN AMOUNT IN £
qt_properties.label: Amount spent on food eaten outside the home
qt_properties.text: And about how much have you and other members of your household spent in total on meals or snacks purchased outside the home in the last four weeks? Please include food bought from takeaways, restaurants, sandwich shops, work or school canteens but do not include alcohol.

qt_properties.iiposttext: IF DON'T KNOW, ASK FOR ESTIMATE ENTER '0' IF NOTHING SPENT WRITE IN AMOUNT IN £
qt_properties.label: Amount spent on alcohol
qt_properties.text: About how much have you and other members of your household spent in total on alcohol in the last four weeks? Please include alcohol purchased from a supermarket or off licence and from pubs, restaurants or other venues.

qt_properties.label: Holiday

option.text: I/We would like to have this but cannot afford this at the moment
option.label: Can't afford it

option.text: I/We do not want/need this at the moment
option.label: Don't need it now

qt_properties.text: Next we have some questions about the sorts of things that some families/people have but which many people have difficulty finding the money for. For each of the following things please tell me the number from the showcard which best explains whether you (and your family/partner) have it or not. Do you (and your family partner) have... A holiday away from home for at least one week a year, whilst not staying with relatives at their home?

qt_properties.label: Friends/family around for drink or meal

option.text: I/We would like to have this but cannot afford this at the moment
option.label: Can't afford it

option.text: I/We do not want/need this at the moment
option.label: Don't need it now

qt_properties.text: Friends or family around for a drink or meal at least once a month?

qt_properties.label: All weather shoes

option.text: I/We would like to have this but cannot afford this at the moment
option.label: Can't afford it

option.text: I/We do not want/need this at the moment
option.label: Don't need it now

qt_properties.text: Two pairs of all weather shoes for all adult members of the family?

qt_properties.label: House in decent state of repair

option.text: I/We would like to have this but cannot afford this at the moment
option.label: Can't afford it

option.text: I/We do not want/need this at the moment
option.label: Don't need it now

qt_properties.text: Enough money to keep your house in a decent state of repair?

qt_properties.label: Household contents insurance

option.text: I/We would like to have this but cannot afford this at the moment
option.label: Can't afford it

option.text: I/We do not want/need this at the moment
option.label: Don't need it now

qt_properties.text: Household contents insurance?

qt_properties.label: Regular savings

option.text: I/We would like to have this but cannot afford this at the moment
option.label: Can't afford it

option.text: I/We do not want/need this at the moment
option.label: Don't need it now

qt_properties.text: Enough money to make regular savings of £10 a month or more for rainy days or retirement?

qt_properties.label: Replace worn out furniture

option.text: I/We would like to have this but cannot afford this at the moment
option.label: Can't afford it

option.text: I/We do not want/need this at the moment
option.label: Don't need it now

qt_properties.text: Enough money to replace any worn out furniture?

qt_properties.label: Replace or repair major electrical goods

option.text: I/We would like to have this but cannot afford this at the moment
option.label: Can't afford it

option.text: I/We do not want/need this at the moment
option.label: Don't need it now

qt_properties.text: Enough money to replace or repair major electrical goods such as a refrigerator or a washing machine, when broken?

qt_properties.iiposttext: CODE 'CAN'T AFFORD IT' AS NO
qt_properties.label: Keep accommodation warm enough
qt_properties.text: For the next question please just answer yes or no. In winter, are you able to keep this accommodation warm enough?

sd_properties.label: Person completing the household questionnaire is the mother or father of a child under 16 in the household

qt_properties.iiposttext: PRIORITY ORDER OF CODES IS 1: Cannot afford, 2: Doesn't need, 3: (all) have ON ALL ITEMS THIS IS THE RESPONDENT'S OWN INTERPRETATION
qt_properties.label: Children have family holidays

option.text: Child(ren) would like to have this but we cannot afford this at the moment
option.label: Can't afford it now

option.text: Child(ren) do not want/need this at the moment
option.label: Don't need it now

qt_properties.text: The next questions are about all the children you NAME (and your partner) are responsible for in this household. Please think about your children when answering these questions For each of the following things please tell me the number from the showcard which best explains whether your child/children has/have it or not. Does your child have/do your children have... A family holiday away from home for at least one week a year?

qt_properties.label: Children have enough bedrooms

option.text: Child(ren) would like to have this but we cannot afford this at the moment
option.label: Can't afford it now

option.text: Child(ren) do not want/need this at the moment
option.label: Don't need it now

qt_properties.text: And are there enough bedrooms for every child of 10 or over of a different sex to have their own bedroom?

qt_properties.label: Children have leisure equipment

option.text: Child(ren) would like to have this but we cannot afford this at the moment
option.label: Can't afford it now

option.text: Child(ren) do not want/need this at the moment
option.label: Don't need it now

qt_properties.text: Leisure equipment such as sports equipment or a bicycle?

qt_properties.label: Children have celebrations on special occassions

option.text: Child(ren) would like to have this but we cannot afford this at the moment
option.label: Can't afford it now

option.text: Child(ren) do not want/need this at the moment
option.label: Don't need it now

qt_properties.text: Celebrations on special occassions such as birthdays, Christmas or other religious festivals?

qt_properties.iiposttext: PRIORITY ORDER OF CODES IS 1: Cannot afford, 2: Doesn't need, 3: (all) have THIS IS THE RESPONDENT'S OWN INTERPRETATION
qt_properties.label: Children go swimming

option.text: Child(ren) would like to do this but we cannot afford this at the moment
option.label: Can't afford it now

option.text: Chil(ren) do not want/need to do this at the moment
option.label: Don't want/need now

qt_properties.text: I now want to ask some questions about whether or not your children can afford to do a number of different activities. Please choose your answer from this card. Does your child/do your children... Go swimming at least once a month?

qt_properties.label: Children do hobbies/leisure activities

option.text: Child(ren) would like to do this but we cannot afford this at the moment
option.label: Can't afford it now

option.text: Chil(ren) do not want/need to do this at the moment
option.label: Don't want/need now

qt_properties.text: Do a hobby or leisure activity?

qt_properties.label: Children have friends round

option.text: Child(ren) would like to do this but we cannot afford this at the moment
option.label: Can't afford it now

option.text: Chil(ren) do not want/need to do this at the moment
option.label: Don't want/need now

qt_properties.text: Have friends around for tea or a snack once a fortnight?

sd_properties.label: Person completing the household questionnaire has a child under 6

qt_properties.iiposttext: PRIORITY ORDER OF CODES IS 1: Cannot afford, 2: Doesn't need, 3: (all) have THIS IS THE RESPONDENT'S OWN INTERPRETATION
qt_properties.label: Children attend nursery/playgroup

option.text: Child(ren) would like to do this but we cannot afford this at the moment
option.label: We can't afford it

option.text: Child(ren) do not want/need this at the moment
option.label: Don't want/need it

option.text: Does not apply/Child(ren) at primary school
option.label: NA Child(ren) at school

qt_properties.text: Does your child/do your children go to a toddler group, nursery or playgroup at least once a week?

sd_properties.label: Person completing the household questionnaire has a child over 5 or child under 5 but already at school

qt_properties.iiposttext: PRIORITY ORDER OF CODES IS 1: Cannot afford, 2: Doesn't need, 3: (all) have THIS IS THE RESPONDENT'S OWN INTERPRETATION
qt_properties.label: Children go on school trips

option.text: Child(ren) would like to do this but we cannot afford this at the moment
option.label: We can't afford it

option.text: Child(ren) do not want/need this at the moment
option.label: Don't want/need it

option.text: Does not apply/Child(ren) not at school
option.label: NA Child(ren) not at sch

qt_properties.text: Does your child/do your children go on school trips?

sd_properties.label: Person completing the household questionnaire is the mother or father of a child under 16 in the household

qt_properties.label: Outdoor space for children to play
qt_properties.text: For the next question just answer yes or no. Does your child/do your children have an outdoor space or facilities where they can play safely?

qt_properties.help: Include vehicles on long term hire and company vehicles if for private use. Exclude those hired from time to time and if used solely in the course of work and vehicles currently unfit for use if there is no intention to repair
qt_properties.iiposttext: INCLUDE COMPANY VEHICLES IF AVAILABLE FOR PRIVATE USE EXCLUDE VEHICLES SOLELY FOR CARRIAGE OF GOODS ENTER NUMBER ENTER '0' IF NO CARS F9 FOR HELP
qt_properties.label: Number of cars in household
qt_properties.text: How many cars or vans in total does your household own or have continuous use of?

sd_properties.label: there are cars in the household

dcomments.dcomment: question added. No range in data (used default of 1..99) but 1..20 looks more plausible

qt_properties.iiposttext: READ OUT IF NECESSARY
qt_properties.label: Engine size
qt_properties.text: What is the engine size of your first/second etc car/van?

qt_properties.iiposttext: IF DRIVEN EQUALLY BY MORE THAN ONE PERSON CODE FIRST PERSON NAMED RECORD PERSON NUMBER FROM HOUSEHOLD GRID
qt_properties.label: Main driver of car
qt_properties.text: Who drives this car most often?

dcomments.dcomment: Most timestamps were returned in a separate TIMINGS file, but have been inserted into the specification at the point at which they were desiged to be recorded. The assumption in all cases is that the timestamp value was assigned on the basis of the system clock.
